title: Richard Fain
text:
Richard Alexander Fain (born February 29, 1968) is an American former professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for two seasons during the early 1990s. Fain played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Florida%20Gators%20football">Florida Gators</a>, and thereafter, he played professionally for the <a href="Cincinnati%20Bengals">Cincinnati Bengals</a>, <a href="Phoenix%20Cardinals">Phoenix Cardinals</a> and <a href="Chicago%20Bears">Chicago Bears</a> of the NFL.
Early years.
Fain was born in <a href="Fort%20Myers%2C%20Florida">Fort Myers, Florida</a>. He attended <a href="North%20Fort%20Myers%20High%20School">North Fort Myers High School</a> in North Fort Myers, and was a standout high school football player for the North Fort Myers Red Knights.
College career.
Fain Accepted an athletic scholarship to attend the <a href="University%20of%20Florida">University of Florida</a> in Gainesville, Florida, where he played for coach <a href="Galen%20Hall">Galen Hall</a> and coach <a href="Steve%20Spurrier">Steve Spurrier</a>'s <a href="Florida%20Gators%20football">Gators</a> teams from <a href="1987%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1987</a> to <a href="1990%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1990</a>. He had ten interceptions in four seasons, and received first-team All-<a href="Southeastern%20Conference">Southeastern Conference</a> (SEC) honors in 1989 and 1990, and was also a second-team <a href="All-American">All-American</a> in 1989 and 1990. Memorably, in 1990, he recovered a punt blocked by <a href="Jimmy%20Spencer%20%28American%20football%29">Jimmy Spencer</a>, and returned it twenty-five yards for a touchdown—the margin of victory in the Gators' 17–13 victory over the <a href="1992%20Alabama%20Crimson%20Tide%20football%20team">Alabama Crimson Tide</a>.
Fain graduated from the University of Florida with a bachelor's degree in exercise and sport sciences in 1990.
Professional career.
The <a href="Cincinnati%20Bengals">Cincinnati Bengals</a> selected Fain in the sixth round (157th pick overall) of the <a href="1991%20NFL%20Draft">1991 NFL Draft</a>, and he played for the Bengals and Phoenix Cardinals during the season. He played his second and final year in the NFL for the <a href="Chicago%20Bears">Chicago Bears</a> in . In Fain's two-season NFL career, he played in twenty-four regular season games and started eight of them.
